intro: Epipactis helleborine subsp. viridans, commonly known as the green helleborine, is a terrestrial orchid native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its dark green, strap-like leaves and produces showy, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive lip. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense colonies. Its botanical features make it a notable species within the Orchidaceae family.
